qas.question: To pay off the people they owed, Greece had to accept what?
The people of Greece that had higher education saw what dialect as beneath them?
A hot topic in Greece in the 19th century was what?

context: Corruption and Trikoupis' increased spending to create necessary infrastructure like the Corinth Canal overtaxed the weak Greek economy, forcing the declaration of <a0_0>public insolvency<a0_0/> in 1893 and to accept the imposition of an <a1_0>International Financial Control authority<a1_0/> to pay off the country's debtors. Another political issue in 19th-century Greece was uniquely Greek: the <a3_0>language<a3_0/> question. The Greek people spoke a form of Greek called <a2_0>Demotic<a2_0/>. Many of the educated elite saw this as a peasant dialect and were determined to restore the glories of Ancient Greek.
